title: INTERESTING TYPE MOVIES?
content:
I've seen "Helvetica", "Linotype" and some short films...  
So do you know of any interesting film/short film to watch related to type in any of it's awesome ways?

Thanks! :)
author: ferfolio

comments.content: Making Faces is a beautiful documentary about Jim Rimmer.

You may find this short film about Berthold interesting:

[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TSBpgTAp8XI](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224118/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=TSBpgTAp8XI "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TSBpgTAp8XI")

It is great seeing the Ikarus system in action.

A good educational film from the 1960s on the Linotype machine, in some respects better than the recent movie in terms of detail (but not as funny):  
 [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6wHiddZOfa8](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224118/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=6wHiddZOfa8 "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6wHiddZOfa8")
I’ve updated the wiki article on [Video](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224118/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Video) to include some of these films linked to.

**[Typography videos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224118/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43707)**

And some others which I try to add to — [http://readthetype.com/videos/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224118/http:/readthetype.com/videos/ "http://readthetype.com/videos/")

Hello!

It's still in development, but I'm currently working with a colleague the "DocTipos - Portuguese Typeface Design Documentary". [For follow up or more info](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224118/http:/doctiposportugues.com/).  
It's a project that aims to understand and document the reality of Typeface design made in Portugal by Portuguese designers.  
We recently release the [official trailer.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224118/http:/doctiposportugues.com/?page_id=214&lang=en)

António

I'm going to trump all these suggestions and give you this amazing doc on letter cutting. Enjoy
